# Analysis of âš¡â”‚general Discord Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment shows brief interactions about accessing and setting up Hyperfy environments. Two main hosting options were mentioned: Edify Engine, designed for non-technical creators, and HyperWorld.Host as an alternative service. A user named "odds" explained that Edify Engine helps creators without technical background to build worlds without needing GitHub or hosting setup knowledge. HypPrivakos shared a link to documentation for self-hosting on fly.io. One user (Fibelius) confirmed plans to build a v2 version of a Kusama exhibition space using one of these platforms. Another user (3rdEyeVisuals) mentioned returning to Hyperfy and having set up docker containers. The conversation was relatively brief with minimal technical depth.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Where can I access Hyperfy? (asked by Harambe Advocate) A: You can use Edify Engine for a non-technical approach or follow the fly.io tutorial (answered by odds and HypPrivakos - HyperWorld.Host)
Q: How do I follow the calls here? (asked by 3moory1061) A: Unanswered

# Analysis of ðŸ§Šâ”‚3d-design Channel Chat

## 1. Summary
The conversation revolves around implementing clickable links in a virtual space. Nicola Bertoglio needed to create clickable elements at specific locations in a virtual gallery to link to artists' websites. Gert-Jan Akerboom initially suggested using the Bio-Links app for Hyperfy V2, but this solution placed links in screen space rather than world space. After understanding Nicola needed world-space UI elements, Gert-Jan modified a default text app to include link functionality. However, this solution worked on desktop but not on mobile devices. The chat highlights the technical challenge of implementing cross-platform interactive elements in 3D spaces, particularly the difference between screen-space and world-space UI elements.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How can I insert a clickable link within my space? (asked by Nicola Bertoglio) A: You can use the Bio-Links app or a modified text app with link functionality (answered by Gert-Jan Akerboom)
Q: Can the app be activated at a specific location in a virtual gallery? (asked by Nicola Bertoglio) A: The Bio-Links app works in screen space, but you need world-space UI elements for location-specific links (answered by Gert-Jan Akerboom)
Q: Do you have any apps to create location-specific clickable elements? (asked by Nicola Bertoglio) A: Gert-Jan updated the default text app to include link functionality (answered by Gert-Jan Akerboom)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Nicola Bertoglio | Context: Needed clickable links in a virtual space | Resolution: Shared Bio-Links app GitHub repository
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Nicola Bertoglio | Context: Needed location-specific clickable elements | Resolution: Modified the default text app to include link functionality
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Nicola Bertoglio | Context: Mobile compatibility issues with modified text app | Resolution: Suggested using ChatGPT for fixes or offered to look at it the following week
